se.jguru.nazgul.test.persistence

Class AbstractJpaTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • se.jguru.nazgul.test.persistence.AbstractJpaTest
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractDbUnitAndJpaTest

    public abstract class AbstractJpaTest
extends Object
    Abstract superclass for JPA based tests.
    Author:
    Lennart Jörelid, jGuru Europe AB

    • Method Detail

      • setUp

        public void setUp()
           throws Exception
        Setting up the JPA framework which setup the Persistence Entity Manager. The framework begins a database transaction before each Test.
        Throws:
        Exception - if an error occurred.

      • getJpaUnitTestConnection

        protected final Connection getJpaUnitTestConnection(boolean startTransactionIfRequired)
                                             throws IllegalStateException
        Retrieves/unwraps the SQL Connection used by the EntityManager. Note that for some JPA implementations - notably EclipseLink - unwrapping a Connection from the EntityManager will retrieve null unless the EntityManager is in a transaction. To avoid any followup problems caused by this, an IllegalStateException will be thrown unless a non-null Connection can properly be retrieved.
        Parameters:
        startTransactionIfRequired - If the entityManager does not have an active EntityTransaction, and the startNewTransaction parameter is true, the EntityManager's Transaction will be started. Otherwise, an Exception will be thrown.
        Returns:
        The SQL Connection used by the entityManager.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if entityManager.getTransaction().isActive() was false.

      • getEntityManagerFactoryProperties

        protected SortedMap<String,String> getEntityManagerFactoryProperties()
        Override to supply any additional EntityManagerFactory properties. The properties are supplied as the latter argument to the Persistence.createEntityManagerFactory method. The properties supplied within this Map override property definitions given in the persistence.xml file.
        Returns:
        Properties supplied to the EntityManagerFactory, implying they do not need to be declared within the persistence.xml file.
        See Also:
        Persistence.createEntityManagerFactory(String, java.util.Map)

      • tearDown

        public void tearDown()
        Tear down the JPA framework and rollback any started transactions.

      • cleanupTestSchema

        protected abstract void cleanupTestSchema(boolean shutdownDatabase)
        Invoked during teardown to clean up the schema used for test.
        Parameters:
        shutdownDatabase - if true, the database should be shutdown after cleaning the schema.

      • getPersistenceXmlFile

        protected abstract String getPersistenceXmlFile()
        Retrieves the classpath-relative path to the persistence.xml file used in this AbstractJpaTest.
        Returns:
        classpath-relative path to the persistence.xml file used in this AbstractJpaTest.

      • getPersistenceUnitName

        protected abstract String getPersistenceUnitName()
        Retrieves the name of the PersistenceUnit, as defined within the Persistence.xml file and also within @Persistence annotations in user classes.
        Returns:
        the name of the active PersistenceUnit.

      • commitAndStartNewTransaction

        protected final void commitAndStartNewTransaction()
        Commits the currently active EntityTransaction, and starts a new EntityTransaction.
        See Also:
        commit(boolean)

      • rollbackAndStartNewTransaction

        protected final void rollbackAndStartNewTransaction()
        Performs rollback on the currently active EntityTransaction, and starts a new EntityTransaction.
        See Also:
        commit(boolean)

      • rollback

        protected final void rollback(boolean startNewTransaction)
                       throws IllegalStateException
        Performs rollback on the currently active EntityTransaction, and starts a new EntityTransaction if told to do so. if true, starts a new EntityTransaction following the rollback of the currently active one.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the Transaction could not be rolled back or begun anew.

      • commit

        protected final void commit(boolean startNewTransaction)
                     throws IllegalStateException
        Commits the currently active EntityTransaction, and starts a new EntityTransaction if so ordered.
        Parameters:
        startNewTransaction - if true, starts a new EntityTransaction following the commit of the currently active one.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the Transaction could not be committed or begun anew.
